title: 2019 Volvo S60 T5 review: comfort and joy in the Swedish alternative to a prestige German saloon
text:
Turning this third-generation Volvo S60 off the speed camera-festooned A9 in Scotland, I glanced at the trip meter; 34.7mpg, at the speed limit all the way from Edinburgh airport.

That’s pretty good for a large, heavy saloon, not far off the new Volvo’s WLTP low/high figures of 35.3/39.8mpg.

The thing is, however, that while it isn’t as fast, BMW’s new 318dSE will easily crack 60mpg when its WLTP figures are officially announced and its emissions are just 113g/km against the Volvo’s 155g/km, which is three VED tax bands and nine benefit-in-kind (BIK) tax bands above the BMW. If you are currently planning your next company car, that makes a mighty compelling argument.

This is the big problem with...
